name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
My 92 year old mother remembers 79 yrs ago, in email to family, Dec 7, 2020:

“The Pearl Harbor attack seems like yesterday. FDR via radio calmed the nation. Sang patriotic songs at school. Had air raid drills. Hid under desks. Our armed forces segregated.”

Mom, keepin’ it real. https://t.co/mRrPhTTx1m

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
This is what happens when Space Aliens discover you're eavesdropping on them.

Or instead, maybe it’s what happens when a country regresses in its urge to lead the world in Science.

https://t.co/1ZPL0s0qH3

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:

Thank you for your persistent interest in all my efforts to bring the Universe down to Earth.

Ten After Ten.

Not too early in the morning.
Not too late in the evening.

Not too tardy.
A good time anywhere in the universe.

I happen to like Ten After Ten. https://t.co/X55ZE3bAGJ

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Wow.  Didn’t think that last tweet needed clarification.

“We're all the same” refers to us being the same species.

The virus doesn’t discriminate. It just cares that you are human.

The virus doesn’t discriminate.  But systems of health care do.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
We assemble Into tribes based on politics, religion, skin color, language, education, birthplace, wealth, & gender expression. Yet COVID-19 reminds us we’re all the same.

The virus doesn’t discriminate, even if we do. https://t.co/ICmyklj8hl

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
On Dec 21, 2020, Jupiter & Saturn slide within a tenth of a degree of each other. If your vision is no better than 20/100, the two planets will look as one. Close encounters among celestial objects are “conjunctions”

Deborah Byrd & Bruce McClure say more:
https://t.co/tbFk5BVooV https://t.co/Cn9tpzwzHu

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Between now and Dec 21 Saturn & Jupiter approach each other on the sky until a mere tenth of a degree separates them. Last time this happened Galileo was alive.

The solar system: A Cosmic Ballet, choreographed by the forces of gravity.

Joe Rao tells all:
https://t.co/lDiyD1LaVL https://t.co/uYszbbnh5R

text:
van Gogh’s “The Starry Night”, Saint Rémy de Provence, France
[Museum of Modern Art, NYC]

Analysis of the crescent Moon and Venus, reveals that the painting captures the early morning hours near the Summer Solstice 1889  — just before sunrise.

So for me, it’s “The Starry Dawn” https://t.co/3JJJdZZSmO

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
How often does a Blue Moon land on Halloween, you may ask?

Depends. It could be November 1 for you, while time zones to your West are still trick-or-treating. Back in the 20th and 21st centuries, the USA saw eight Halloween Blue Moons: 1906 1925 1944 2020 2039 2058 2077 & 2096. https://t.co/KxYQeQLY6w

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
The expression “Once in a Blue Moon” is colloquial for “The thing hardly ever happens.”  But If you meant it literally, then that thing will occur every two or three years.

So, like most cosmic happenings, Blue Moons aren't entirely rare, even if we want to think they are.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Blue Moon alert:

This year, a Full Moon lands on Halloween. With a 29.5-day cycle of phases, any time you squeeze two full moons into a month, the second one is called the “Blue Moon.”

Yes, that means February is S.O.L. in its bid for Blue Moons. https://t.co/6u7g95ZCH1

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Thanks for participating in my two-day, 14-question Twitter Poll.  Nearly everyone who answered did so within 12 hours.   Thanks for this enthusiasm.

What follows is a thread of my Reflections on the statistics of who you are.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Two Day, 14-Question Anonymous Poll

You know who I am. But to communicate with you better, I’d like to learn (statistically) who you are.

If interested, what follows is a 14-question (14-Tweet) threaded anonymous poll.

Should take you less than a minute to complete.
Thank you.

text:
The two-thousand-tweet response to my "A Coronavirus walks into a bar..." request was entertaining.

I tasked Brian Malow (whose actual handle is @ScienceComedian) to collate the best – and the worst – in a Twitter-thread.

Here they are. Thanks, Brian.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
This joke needs a good ending, but I can't think of one:

"A coronavirus walks into a bar…”

...or shall we all wash our hands of such humor?

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
SCIENTISTS: “@OSiRISRex intercepted asteroid Bennu, 300-million km away, to retrieve samples for lab analysis.
RESPONSE: “Oooh!”

SCIENTISTS: “Research shows humans are catastrophically warming Earth”
RESPONSE: “That conflicts with what I want to be true, so it must be false.”

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Asteroid 2018VP1, a refrigerator-sized space-rock, is hurtling towards us at more than 40,000 km/hr.

It may buzz-cut Earth on Nov 2, the day before the Presidential Election.

It’s not big enough to cause harm. So if the World ends in 2020, it won’t be the fault of the Universe. https://t.co/eiy9G9w4Ez

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Note to HOLLYWOOD:

No reason to think space aliens would have the same array of senses — sight, hearing, taste, touch, smell — as humans. They could have more senses than we do. Or all their senses could be completely different from ours.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Note to HOLLYWOOD:

A space alien with no DNA in common with life on Earth should look more different from life on Earth than **any** two life forms on Earth look from each other.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
You'd be inexcusably egocentric to suggest that Earth was the only place in the observable Universe with life -- among the hundred-billion galaxies, each containing a hundred-billion stars orbited by a hundred-billion planets.

Yet how terrifyingly lonely it would be, if true.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: If you must know:  The word parsec is a contraction of “parallax-second”, the distance a star would be from the Sun if one half of its parallax angle subtended one second of arc.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Ignoring the Kessel Run abomination in Star Wars, a Parsec is an obscure unit of distance in classical astronomy equal to 3.26 light years. A megaparsec is a million of these. So for every megaparsec, the universe is expanding an additional 70 km/sec — the famous Hubble Constant. https://t.co/OKyzlNCESY

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Nothing to tweet today, except for all those who wanted more space, the Universe continues to expand at about 70 kilometers per second, per Megaparsec.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Credit to Pope Gregory’s Jesuit priests for figuring out the Julian calendar needed updating - before telescopes, and while Christendom was sure the Sun orbited Earth. 

Fifty years later, Jesuits would prosecute Galileo for saying (and flaunting) that Earth orbits the Sun. https://t.co/2bX20b0wP4

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: By 1582, the Julian calendar, with a Leap Day every four years, had accumulated TEN extra days relative to Earth’s orbit.  So Pope Gregory jump-started his new and exquisitely accurate calendar by canceling 10 days that year, in which October 4 was followed by October 15.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
The 1582 Gregorian update to the Julian Calendar prescribes: The century years 1600 1700 1800 1900 & 2000 are all divisible by four, but 1700 1800 1900 were not leap years, yet 1600 & 2000 were. And 2400 will be.

On February 29, 2000 most had no idea how rare that Leap Day was.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
The Leap Day alone overcorrects the calendar, requiring we remove a Leap Day every century year.

But that under-corrects the calendar, requiring we put a Leap Day back in, every four centuries. 

Behold the Gregorian Calendar.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The film "Ad Astra" showed an excellent lunar landscape. Desolate. Without color. Bright in sunlight. Dark in shadows. Daytime starry skies. Except the length of shadows should have been much longer, extending in front of them, just before crossing to the Moon's darkened far side https://t.co/xgn5PpLWkY

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The film "Ad Astra" loves showing weightless astronauts. But space is not inherently weightless. If your engines fire constantly because you're in a hurry to get to the Moon or to Mars, then the acceleration creates artificial gravity — at the rear-end of the ship. Always.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The film "Ad Astra" has Moon Pirates. Moon Pirates? What are they thinking? Buried treasures on the Moon?  If the Pirates knew how expensive it is to be a Pirate in space, they might have just stayed on Earth and become investment bankers. https://t.co/uFRULeSocy

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: FYI: There is no cause to blame anything that happens to the star Betelgeuse on @realDonaldTrump

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Indeed, Betelgeuse may have already exploded —  now a ghost, a "dead star walking" across the Galaxy — with the light-speed signal of its demise not yet arrived here on Earth.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Betelgeuse is the star's common name — Arabic for "Armpit of the Great One".  Its catalog name is Alpha Orionis. Two thirds of all stars in the night sky with names have Arabic names. An homage to their "stellar" navigational skills 1000 years ago, during the Golden Age of Islam.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Beginning late summer of 2019, the reddish star Betelgeuse has dropped from the 7th to the 21st brightest star in the nighttime sky.  No need to panic, but If it exploded, the flash would be visible in the daytime, and rival the brightness of the Moon for weeks. https://t.co/KHvJjV3neB

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Betelgeuse was born about 10 million years ago — long after Earth's big dinosaurs roamed the land. But the star is now near death. No need to panic, but stellar evolution models tell us that it will likely explode as a Supernova sometime within the next 100,000 years. https://t.co/h7YKSK3nO9

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The star Betelgeuse is so large, if you swapped it with the Sun, it would engulf the orbit of Mars and extend all the way through the asteroid belt. name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Dear Millennials,

One in four Tweets I might post qualifies for the response, "OK, Boomer."  So instead, I withhold the Tweet, and just say "OK, Boomer” to myself, thereby sparing you the obligation to reply, and me from cross-generational humiliation.

OK, Millennials?

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Not that anybody asked, but the Moon’s orbit is spiraling away from Earth at a rate of nearly 1.5 inches (4 cm) per year. In response, Earth’s rotation rate is slowly slowing, necessitating a Leap Second to be added to the calendar, every now and then.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, & Friday are named for the Norse Gods: Tiw, Woden, Thor (yes, Thor) & Frigga. But if you reference those days in any Romance language you recover their Classical planet names.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: With names traceable to the seven “classical” planets: Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, the Sun, & Moon, the seven days of the week include Monday, named for our precious Moon.  Now guess who in the universe Saturday & Sunday are named after.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: In case you’ve ever wondered, our Moon is not nameless in the universe. Its official Latin term is LUNA. And for the rest of us: Earth = TERRA.  Sun = SOL

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: During a solar eclipse, the Moon’s shadow crosses Earth’s surface at speeds exceeding 1,000  mph. So if you're in the path, the poetic phrase, “I’m being followed by a Moon Shadow” is just wrong. Better: "I’m being chased by a Moon Shadow that will catch me and darken my skies."

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Solar Eclipses are one of Nature’s  great spectacles: The Sun is 400x  wider than the Moon and 400x farther away, making them the same size on the sky -- endowing Earth with the most badass eclipses in the Solar System. https://t.co/N2kzWvCM75

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: White Light is an illusion — first demonstrated by Isaac Newton (Opticks 1704) to be comprised of all the colors of the rainbow.  Our brains “see” White when our eyes are exposed to equal amounts of each color in the rainbow. https://t.co/65x9iXJd9L

FYI: A garden-variety metallic asteroid contains vastly more gold than has ever been mined in the history of the world.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Sure, Thanos is singularly evil. But I bet he flunked Astro 101.

He wants to kill half of all living things to save the other half — due to limited resources.

But the universe has vastly more resources than can possibly be consumed by civilizations that have access to space.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
Not that anybody asked, but…
 
Measure the circumference of your head in inches, then divide that number by Pi. That’s your Hat size.

Mathematically, your Hat size is the diameter of your head in inches if your head were a perfect sphere.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
So that we're all on the same Pi-page…

If you measure the Circumference of a circle and divide it by the Diameter of the same circle, you get the value of Pi.  And that value of Pi is the same for ANY size circle you draw.

text: #IKnewIWasOld when I stopped liking Barbecue Potato Chips

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I started liking all the Music my parents listened to.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I saw the next generation complain about social issues that my generation didn’t yet have the awareness to notice.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when the urge to go exercise was easily overrun by the competing urge to take a nap.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when at Restaurants, I started ordering appetizers for my main course.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I could no longer do a full split on a dance floor, but also no longer cared that I couldn’t.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I started caring more about what is objectively true than about hurting people’s feelings.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when my family started buying number-candles to represent my age on a Cake rather than single candles themselves.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld the day my growing son was simultaneously bigger than I wanted to lift, and bigger than I was able lift.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I could swallow a shot of Whisky without wincing.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I would walk past a Candy Store and not even notice I was walking past a Candy Store.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when the threat of being sent to bed early sounded like a reward rather than a punishment.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I started liking Blue-Cheese

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when I had no interest in accelerating faster than the guy next to me out of the traffic light that just turned green.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #IKnewIWasOld when on my 60th birthday, I didn’t feel a day over 60.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
A GOLFER QUERIES A BASEBALL PLAYER:

Where’s the ball when you swing?

Whizzing by at 90 mph - the pitcher does not want me to hit it.

How quiet Is the crowd?

They’re making as much noise as possible.

How much time do you have to swing?

Four tenths of a second.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text:
A BASEBALL PLAYER QUERIES A GOLFER:

How fast is the ball moving when you swing?

It’s stationary - at my feet.

Does the crowd cheer?

No, they’re silent — even the announcers whisper.

After you hit the ball, where do you run?

We don’t run at all — often, we don’t even walk.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I commonly wear neckties and vests with cosmic stuff on it, like space-quilts on a kid’s bed.  #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I’ll choose a scoop of ice-cream over almost any fancy dessert on a Restaurant Menu. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: In the shower, I squeeze the little soaps to see how far they will fly out of my hand. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Approximately half the time I shake someone's hand, I think of thumb-wrestling them. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I can fall asleep practically anywhere, and in any position. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I'm perfectly content eating Hot Dogs & Potato Chips for dinner. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I commonly laugh loudly around other Adults who are not. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Love Malted Milkshakes with bendy straws. And for the last drops, my straw's making suction-sounds. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I occasionally long for someone to read "Good Night Moon" to me as I fall asleep. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: During gentle snowfalls, I try to catch Snowflakes on my tongue, but only the big, clumpy ones. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I occasionally free-swivel 360 degrees in those oversized chairs during important Board Meetings. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I'd rather attend a Party than host one. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I've argued with people 1/4 my age about the actual mass of Mjolnir, Thor's Hammer. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I feel strongly that BB-8 is waaaay cuter than R2-D2. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I order Hot Chocolate (with whipped cream) instead of Coffee at places where both are served. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I’ll shake hands with adults, but if they have little kids, I crouch down and high-five them. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Although I can successfully resist, I have the urge to jump two-footed into Mud Puddles that I pass. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Mary Poppins, the Broadway musical, remains one of my all-time favorites. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I'll order fresh-squeezed Lemonade instead of Beer at any event where both are served. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I occasionally use Emoticons in important emails to high ranking officials. : - )  #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I look for a place to put my gum that nobody will notice when I'm not supposed to be chewing it. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Sometimes I tell jokes that Middle-School kids are more likely to laugh at than are adults.  #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I’m briefly giddy when I find string-cheese in my lunch. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I still like the film "Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure". #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I eat dessert first if the Host is foolish enough to set it on the table next to the main course. #ExpressionsOfImmaturity

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Stuff I do that falls well-below my expected level of Maturity...

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Quinn” & “Tessence” — From Quintessence, the fifth essence after Earth Air, Water, & Fire.  Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins"

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Aster” & “Roid” — Losing ideas fast, so will stop here. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Crescent" & “Gibbous” — Two phases of the Moon that are not New, Full, or Half.  Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Up” & “Down”; “Top” & “Bottom”; “Strange” & “Charmed” — Quark Pairs. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Spirit” & “Opportunity” — Twin intrepid @NASA rovers on Mars. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Zenith" & "Nadir” – The points directly above your head and directly below your feed on the sky.  #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Oblate” & “Prolate” – Distorted spheres, resembling the shapes of a hamburger and a hot-dog. #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Perigee” & “Apogee” – The nearest and farthest points from Earth in the Moon’s oval orbit. #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Elgenubi” & “Eschamali” — From the constellation Libra, the Scales. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Kuiper” & “Oort” — The Solar System’s two great Comet repositories. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Ida” & “Dactyl” — First asteroid (Ida) known with a moon (Dactyl). Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Castor” & “Pollux” — Brightest stars of the constellation Gemini, the Twins. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Dawn” & “Dusk” — The sky just before sunrise and just after sunset. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Terra” & “Luna” - Latin for Earth & Moon.  Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Phobos” & “Deimos” - The two moons of Mars. Cosmic #NamesForBeyonceTwins

text: The annual combined Federal budgets of the NEA & NEH equals 4hrs & 23min of spending on the US Military.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Cutting the NEA & NEH on a $3-trillion budget is like thinking a 2-min cellphone video is large relative to a 3Tb Hard Drive.

text: Cutting the NEA & NEH to save money on a $3-trillion budget is like thinking 3 days is long relative to an 85-year lifespan.

text: Still calendrically curious? More than you ever cared to know about Leap Days [3min 20sec]: https://t.co/okplekIJ12

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: If you are born on a Leap Day, you share this distinction with about 1 out of 1,400 people in the world.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Don’t like Leap Days? We could instead wait 28 years and insert a “Leap Week”.  Or 112 years and insert a “Leap Month”.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: According to Gregorian rules, only 1 in 4 century years is a leap year — the rarity of 2000’s leap day went largely unnoticed

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The Leap Day is misnamed. We’re not leaping anywhere. The calendar is simply, and abruptly, catching up with Earth’s orbit

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Born on a leap day? You’ve had 1/4 as many birthdays as the rest of us, but sorry, you’re not 1/4th as old.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Earth takes nearly 365 1/4 days to orbit the Sun. Bank the fraction. Every 4 years add a whole day back to the neediest month

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Welcome Twitterverse, to the 105th leap day of the Gregorian Calendar...

text: Hey @JohnAllenPaulos, Why are the equilateral triangle & square the only regular shapes that can tile an area? I want more!

text: Hey @JohnAllenPaulos, The value of Pi at my NYC corner deli is $9.49 a slice. What’s the value Pi in Philadelphia, your home?

text: Hey @JohnAllenPaulos, Of the 5 regular solids Cube/Tetrahedron/Octahedron/Icosahedron/Dodecahedron four sound like dinosaurs

text: Hey @JohnAllenPaulos, Who had the deranged idea to name the square root of negative one “imaginary” ?

text: Hey @JohnAllenPaulos, Why not come up with a name for non-Euclidean Geometry, rather than telling us what it’s not?

text: Hey @JohnAllenPaulos, Been wanting to divide by Zero all my life. But it’s “undefined”. So get along and define the thing.

text: Hey @JohnAllenPaulos, I (and many others) still think there should be a big number called a Zillion.  Please work on this.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge it was people who were smart, and phones that were dumb.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge James Bond was probably infected with multiple STDs.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenMyParentsWereYourAge “In God We Trust" was neither on our money, the Pledge of Allegiance, or the front wall of Congress

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge The weather started feeling cold in September.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge My car got seven miles per gallon. Ten, downhill. Twelve, with a tailwind.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge, Before scooper laws, nobody knew for sure what squeezing Dog Poop into the palm of your hand felt like.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge You could kiss your loved-one goodbye at the airport gate. And return home.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge People dressed up when they flew on Airplanes.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge A commercial airplane, the Concorde, cruised at twice the speed of sound — 3x faster than planes today.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge America had the tallest buildings in the world.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge America launched its own Astronauts into space — with its own Spaceships.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge We cured diseases and went to the Moon, benchmarking our usage of the word “Awesome."

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Rain Forests were called Jungles. And Wetlands were called Swamps.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Sauce was called Gravy.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Partly sunny days were called partly cloudy.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge All hotel rooms smelled of cigarette smoke.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Second-hand smoke was when somebody offered you a toke on whatever they were puffing.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge An ashtray was a time-honored gift you could bring to a person's home.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Extracting ketchup from its narrow-necked glass bottle occasionally made you question the laws of gravity.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge We had candy cigarettes, gun-shaped cigarette lighters, and sucked flavored sugar through a straw.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Corn Pops Frosted Flakes & Honey Smacks were instead called Sugar Pops Sugar Frosted Flakes & Sugar Smacks

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge We consumed Twinkles, Cool Whip, and Yoo-hoo, without questioning their chemical composition.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Milk was not yet the farthest thing from the front entrance to your grocery store.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge A photograph lived inside your camera, cloaked in mystery for weeks, until you took exactly 35 more photos.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Photographs were records of your life experience, and not the life experience itself.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge Pluto was a planet. T-Rex dragged his tail. And the Brontosaurus was always chewing vegetation.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: A rant on #WhenIWasYourAge follows…

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

text: Thanks to all Birthday well-wishers in the Twitterverse.  Born in 1958, yet I don’t feel a day over 57.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The @MartianMovie — where the protagonist survives not on Wit, Prayer, or Hope. but by “Sciencing the Shit" out of everything

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The @MartianMovie may be the first SciFi blockbuster — ever —  in which nobody dies.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: In the @MartianMovie, they got crucial science right, while enhancing the story by fictionalizing the science that remained.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The @MartianMovie — where you experience Love, Hate, Envy, Anxiety, Pride, & Heroism, all through the lens of science.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The @MartianMovie — where science, not human emotion, drives the plot’s Humor, Interpersonal Relations, Tension, & Suspense.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The @MartianMovie — where you learn all the ways that being Scientifically Literate can save your life.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The @MartianMovie — where Science, Technology, Engineering, & Math are highly developed characters unto themselves.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The @MartianMovie — where fluency in Science, Technology, Engineering, & Math rule all decisions of survival.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: In the @MartianMovie #JPL tracks astronauts. Nope, #JSC does it alone. But watching two @NASA centers collaborate — geek gold

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Evidence that the @MartianMovie is fantasy: The USA & China cooperate with one another in Space.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Evidence that the @MartianMovie is fantasy: All who make important decisions are scientifically literate.

text: Visitors wax poetic about Southern Hemisphere skies. Why? Light pollution in the North leaves most of us starved for darkness

text: The Southern Cross is a tad over-rated: It’s the smallest of all 88 — a fist at arm’s length covers it entirely.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Were it not for @NASA & kindred programs of discovery, I wonder what hope would remain for our species to rise above itself.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: “The Pluto Files” book became a 52 min PBS-NOVA special in 2010, now viewable for free: http://t.co/iWBhcdiGSJ

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: I wrote “The Pluto Files” book http://t.co/10A4Dykg63 in recovery after years of hate-mail from school children.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: Was an accessory in the “demotion" of Pluto. But I didn’t pull the trigger. That was self-confessed @PlutoKiller

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: @NewHorizons2015 went 4-billion miles to buzzcut Pluto by 120,000 miles. A hole-in-one on a 2-mile golf shot.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: First rule of Science: Must Finish experiment before you die. @NewHorizons2015 was launched fast. Reached Pluto in 9 years.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: As reported in the @NYTimes in 1930, when discovered, Pluto was presumed to be the size of Earth.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: Pluto would fit comfortably between New York & Dallas. Between Rome & Moscow.  Between Perth & Melbourne.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: The moons Ganymede Titan Callisto Europa Io Titan & our Moon are all bigger than Pluto. Get over that one too.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: In the @Disney pantheon, Goofy wears clothes, is bipedal, owns a home. Pluto is butt naked, lives in a dog house

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: In the @Disney pantheon, Mickey wears clothes & Pluto does not. Enabling Mickey (a mouse) to own Pluto (a dog).

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: In 1979, Pluto crossed Neptune’s orbit, and for 20 years was the eighth “planet” in the solar system.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts Pluto’s primary moon Charon is so large that their mutual center-of-mass lies not within Pluto but in empty space

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts: Ever since Pluto was discovered in 1930, it has completed barely 1/3 of its own 248 year orbit around the Sun.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Another favorite Pluto song. The one that started them all.  By Folk singer Christine Lavin. http://t.co/ynhWK87YgX

text: My Favorite Pluto song: @JonathanCoulton sings of the demotion, as felt by Pluto’s moon Charon: http://t.co/tGRqQHrurS

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #PlutoFacts:  Earth’s Moon is five times more massive than Pluto.  Get over it.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Religion was taught in Sunday School, not in your Science Classroom.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Thanks for your time.  I think I’ve got only one more left in me...

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: The Soviet KGB would’ve killed for the surveillance & checkpoint measures that are common in the USA today

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Looking up somebody's number in the Phone Book was only one of a dozen household uses for it.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: You needed a can opener to open a can of beer. And you’d put two holes in it. The second, for air flow.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: There was hardly any transparent plastic.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: There were ten known asteroids with orbits crossing Earth's. Now, we know more than ten-thousand.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: We actually used a sheet of paper laced with carbon to make a carbon copy — “the cc:" -- of a Letter.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: PaulSimon wrote this pre-GlobalWarming lyric "The autumn winds blow chilly & cold, September I'll remember”

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Exhaust from City buses billowed at the perfect height for everybody nearby to inhale it.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: People were never "living with their disease". We cured them. Or they died from it.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Airplanes were so loud, you had to pause your conversation whenever one flew overhead.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: No matter what they contained, Bottles were not squeezable.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Your home telephone could drop to the floor thousands of times and never break.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: We made phone calls in Phone Booths, which is also where Superman occasionally changed his clothes.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: On average, the Moon was about 1.5 meters closer to Earth than it is today.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Earth's daily rotation was about a half a millisecond faster than today.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Before Xerox copiers, we all got high in elementary school by smelling mimeograph ink.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: The average Watermelon had a Billion seeds in it.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: When you fell off the monkey-bars in the playground you landed on cement.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: We used large Maps made of paper, and none of us could ever re-fold them back the way they came.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: My car got seven miles per gallon. With a tail-wind.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: You knew where & when the constellations could be found in the sky by using your “Brain App”.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: The meat in a fast-food Hamburger was as large as the Bun itself.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: We went to the Moon -- nine times. Today, in low Earth-Orbit, we boldly go where hundreds have gone before.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Your expected age of death was much closer to your age of retirement.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Oooookay...

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Want more?  Or am I clogging your inbox?

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: People were skinnier.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: There were hardly any one-way streets.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: You had to actually get off your butt, and approach the TV to change the channel.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Being "all thumbs" meant you were clumsy.  Today it means you’re good at texting.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: We had to open all doors by ourselves. None of them knew we were coming.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: It took a week to learn whether your photos came out okay.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: It took a whole hour to bake a potato.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Pluto was a planet, but those "in the know" all knew its days were numbered.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Weather predictions were no more than guesses about whether it might rain tomorrow.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: Anything wrapped in plastic was easy to open.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: #WhenIWasYourAge: None of my toothpaste tubes could stand up on their caps.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I’m feeling pensive & reflective of years gone by. If you’ll indulge me, I’d like to share some of these observations...

text: The greatest examples of human control over Evolution are found in Agriculture and in #TheDogShow.

text: Thanksgiving in the USA. Of a time when food was scarce. Now abundant, at dinner we over-eat even more than we usually do.

text: Times Have Changed: Officer kills an unarmed Black man, spawning National protests. When I grew up, this was just local news.

text: Mysteries of #Interstellar: How a pickup truck can drive with a flat tire among densely planted corn stalks taller than it.

text: Nine “Mysteries of #Interstellar to come...

text: I wonder if Farm Animals think deep thoughts while standing around doing nothing. I also wonder if they wonder the same of us

text: In #Interstellar: They explore a planet near a Black Hole. Personally, I’d stay as far the hell away from BlackHoles as I can

text: REMINDER: Never look to me for opinions on new films. All I do is highlight the science one might or might not find in them.

text: In #Interstellar, if you didn’t understand the plot, there is no published book to help you.

text: In #Interstellar: On another planet, around another star, in another part of the galaxy, two guys get into a fist fight.

text: In #Interstellar: Of the leading characters (all of whom are scientists or engineers) half are women. Just an FYI.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: In #Interstellar: They reprise the matched-rotation docking maneuver from "2001: A Space Odyssey," but they spin 100x faster.

text: In #Interstellar: You enter a 3-Dimensional portal in space. Yes, you can fall in from any direction. Yes, it’s a Worm Hole.

text: In #Interstellar: You observe great Tidal Waves from great Tidal Forces, of magnitude that orbiting a Black Hole might create

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Relativity. Gravity. Quantum. Electrodynamics. Evolution. Each of these theories is true, whether or not you believe in them.

text: In #Interstellar: Experience Einstein's Curvature of Space as no other feature film has shown.

text: GPS Satellites are pre-corrected for General Relativity, allowing them to beam us the accurate time for Earth’s surface.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: In #Interstellar: And in the real universe, strong gravitational fields measurably slow passage of time relative to others.

text: If Detroit added a pro-sports team & called it the Bears, the City could boast it was home to the Lions and Tigers and Bears.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Just passed my 4000th tweet -- an arbitrary moment enhanced by base-ten. Thanks to all for interest in these mental musings.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: There are surely problems in the universe so advanced that our human brain cannot see them as problems in need of solution.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I think not enough good Hot Chocolate is served in the world. A comfort food without equal.

text: After 20 years & 5 championships, Derek Jeter’s last game (ever) in Yankee Stadium tonight. Won with a walk off hit. Farewell

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Got a bunch more Southern Hemisphere tidbits, but I think I’ll save them for even later...

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: So “Alpha" Centauri is the brightest star in the constellation Centaurus. And “Beta" Pictoris is the 2nd brightest in Pictor.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Apart from common names, stars are generally ID'ed in order of brightness within a constellation, using the Greek alphabet.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The Southern skies have the closest star system to the Sun - the famed “Alpha Centauri”  The 3rd brightest in the night sky.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Earth is closest to the Sun during the Southern Hemisphere Summer. For the North, that of course coincides with our winter.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Many big telescope in the North have twins in the South, giving astrophysicists coherent full-sky coverage of the Universe.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Just an FYI: Earth’s South Magnetic Pole is actually in the North. That’s why the North tip of a compass needle points there.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The center of the Milky Way — a target of study for my PhD — passes directly overhead for all middle southern latitudes.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: “Arctic" derives from Arktos, the Greek word for Bear. The Arctic's got em. (For now.) The Ant-Arctic doesn't.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: What’s the North Pole? Curl the fingers of your right hand in the direction of rotation. Stick out your thumb. That’s North.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: ˙ʇdǝɔuoɔ pǝuᴉɟǝp ʎlǝsᴉɔǝɹd ʇnq 'ʎɹɐɹʇᴉqɹɐ uɐ sᴉ sʇɔǝɾqo ƃuᴉuuᴉds ɹoɟ ǝloԀ ɥʇnoS puɐ ǝloԀ ɥʇɹoN ǝɥʇ llɐɔ ǝʍ ʇɐɥM

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Good Morning Australia. Resuming my tweets intended for you and everyone else down under -- south of the Equator.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Hmm. I think I’ll take a break for 6 or 7 hours — until the Aussies wake up — then continue the Southern Hemisphere hijinks.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Sundials designed for the North won't work in the Southern Hemisphere. If ported there, they would reckon time backwards.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: In the North, the shadow of a sundial’s gnomon sweeps clockwise. That’s, in fact, what defined clockwise in the first place.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Some of us in the North are jealous that 100% of the world’s population of free Penguins live in the Southern Hemisphere.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Earth is not only oblate — wider at the equator than pole-to-pole, but pear shaped — slightly wider just south of the equator

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Earth's centrifugal force at the Equator renders everybody and everything about 6% lighter than they’d weigh at the poles.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: At a revolution speed of 1,700 km / hour, the equator is Earth’s fastest moving part. All other latitudes move more slowly.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I think it's cool that there's a country on the equator with the name "Equator". Better known in Spanish as Ecuador

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Antarctica’s subglacial Lake Vostok is a body of water, trapped in ice, that hasn’t seen air in at least 15-million years.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The flag in Antarctica that ID's the South Pole has to be repositioned  every year. The glacier beneath moves continuously.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: The South Pole is covered with land: Antarctica. In the North, Santa’s gotta live on an (ever-shrinking) slab of floating ice

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: At about 2800 meters above sea level, the South Pole plateau sits at an elevation almost as high as that of Mount Olympus.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: Toilet Bowls drain however they're designed to circulate water.  It’s irrelevant whether you live above or below the equator.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: I don’t ever want Southern Hemispherians to feel neglected.  So I now offer some tweets just for lands down under...

text: For survival in this world, it’s to an animal's great advantage if Humans think you're cute.

text: FYI: Every month, the Moon gets just as large as tonight’s Full Moon. During its New, Crescent, Half, or Gibbous phases.

text: Knee-slapping humor to a topologist: Question: Why did the chicken cross the Möbius Strip? Answer: To get to the same side.

text: Just to settle it once and for all: Which came first the Chicken or the Egg? The Egg -- laid by a bird that was not a Chicken

text: Happy 75th anniv. to The Wizard of Oz. Gotta love it even though Lions & Tigers & Bears hail from three different continents.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: "And Toto too?" Happy 75th anniv. to The Wizard of Oz. Gotta love it even though Scarecrow got the Pythagorean theorem wrong.

text: The Perseids they're called -- a meteor shower these nights. But ruined, this year, by the Full Moon's light.

text: July’s full moon is to August's "Super Moon” what a 16.0 inch pizza is to a 16.1 inch pizza. I’m just saying.

text: The @UPS tracking uses 17 digits & one letter. Enough for 2.6 quintillion packages. That's 370 million per person on Earth.

text: Laws of physics describing gravity & energy conspire to make spheres (like the soccer ball) a common shape in the Universe.

text: Seasons are caused by the 23.5-degree tilt in Earth’s axis. Without it, fashion would need a different excuse to change.

text: Earth is closest to the Sun in January -- "Perihelion".  But USA Astronomers celebrate the July 4th Aphelion with fireworks.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
text: July 4, 2014. At 94.5-million miles, Earth, in its oval orbit, is at "Aphelion" --  our farthest distance from the Sun.
